description: Dive into "Snap the Soul of Indore" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Snap the Soul of Indore

places.generalDescription: The Annapurna Temple is an ornate Hindu temple in Indore, India dedicated to the goddess of food, Annapurna. Thousands of pilgrims and tourists visit this shrine every year, drawn by its imposing facade and gilded gate.

sources.snippet: Annapurna Temple deserves a place in your list of must-visit places in Indore due to its impressive architectural beauty. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Annapurna, the deity of food and an incarnation of Goddess Parvati. The temple also has shrines dedicated to Shiva, Kalabhairava, and Hanuman.
sources.shortName: Top 34 Places to Visit in Indore: Location, Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: The Annapurna Temple, besides being a place for pilgrimages is also a tourist attraction. Dedicated to Goddess Annapurna, the deity of food the temple also houses the shrines of Sivan, Hanuman and Kalabhairava.
sources.shortName: 38 Places to visit in Indore India 2025

places.name: Shri Annapurna Temple, Indore

reviews.text:
This temple is dedicated to Maa Annapurna and stands out for its stunning architecture and serene atmosphere. The structure is single-leveled, but its beauty lies in the intricate details that adorn every part of it. The temple is supported by numerous finely carved pillars, each featuring beautiful architectural engravings that reflect traditional craftsmanship. Constructed entirely with white marble, the temple walls, pillars, and boundary are adorned with delicate carvings of various gods and goddesses, especially from the Malwa region's artistic style.

At the heart of the temple resides the deity of Maa Annapurna. The inner sanctum offers a peaceful and calming environment, making it an ideal place for meditation or quiet reflection. The marble flooring adds to the soothing vibe, encouraging visitors to sit and absorb the divine energy of the space.

From the outside, the temple is equally captivating. Especially during the evening, it is beautifully illuminated with white and blue lighting that gives the entire structure a divine and ethereal glow. The temple is not just visually impressive, but also thoughtfully designed for visitor comfort. A dedicated footwear stand is available to the left of the entrance for safekeeping.

Within the same temple complex, there are several smaller shrines, including one dedicated to Lord Shiva. I also noticed a covered well, suggesting that the temple has historical roots and has likely undergone renovations over time. Interestingly, the temple is usually not very crowded, which allows visitors to fully appreciate its spiritual and architectural charm in a calm and peaceful setting.

Maintenance good...
No parking except two wheeler...
Annapurna, the deity of food, and is one of the oldest pilgrimage sites in Indore. The temple was constructed in the 9th century and was rebuilt in 1959 by Mahamandaleshwar Swami Prabanandagirimharaj. The main gate of the temple was constructed in 1975. With a blend of Indo-Aryan and Dravidian architectural styles, the temple is regarded as the architectural heritage of the city due to its intricate carvings & detailed paintings
Beautiful temple in the city of Indore. Ample parking inside the temple. Quite spacious and clean campus. Loved the atmosphere and simple architecture. Please keep the place when you visit üôè

places.address: Annapurna Rd, Annapurna Mandir, Kranti Kriplani Nagar, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452009, India

Recently renovated, it stands as a historic masterpiece with intricate detailing and spacious courtyards. The palace hosts grand festivals and is surrounded by bustling markets.

places.name: Rajwada Palace

reviews.text:
Visiting Rajwada Palace was like stepping into a piece of living history. The majestic architecture, blending Maratha grandeur with Mughal elegance, instantly transported me to a bygone era. The intricate wooden balconies, giant arched gateways, and detailed carvings are absolutely breathtaking - a true architectural gem in the heart of Indore.
What made the visit truly magical was seeing the palace illuminated at night. The lighting transforms the entire structure into a glowing monument, highlighting its regal charm and creating a serene yet majestic atmosphere. It's a perfect spot for photography lovers, history buffs, or anyone who appreciates beauty and culture.
Whether you're visiting during the day or just taking an evening walk nearby, Rajwada is not to be missed. A stunning blend of history, beauty, and Indore's rich heritage, especially unforgettable under the evening lights.

‚≠ê Rajwada Palace, Indore

Rajwada Palace is one of the most iconic landmarks of Indore and a must-visit for anyone exploring the city. üè∞‚ú®
‚Ä¢	üìç Located in the heart of the old city, surrounded by bustling markets.
‚Ä¢	üèõÔ∏è A blend of Maratha, Mughal, and French architecture that showcases the city's rich heritage.
‚Ä¢	üå≥ The area around the palace has a royal charm with gardens and temples nearby.
‚Ä¢	üì∑ A great spot for history lovers and photographers.
‚Ä¢	üï∞Ô∏è Best visited in the evening when the palace is beautifully lit up.

The only thing to keep in mind is that it can get a bit crowded, especially during festivals. üö∂‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

‚úÖ Overall, a must-visit heritage site in Indore to experience the city's glorious past.

Rating: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚òÜ (4.5/5)

Rajwada Palace is a historic gem of Indore, well-maintained with good cleanliness and overall in great condition. The architecture is beautiful and gives a real glimpse of the city's rich heritage. However, in the back building on the first floor, I noticed some people spitting gutka on the windows, which spoils the charm of such a grand monument. With stricter monitoring, this place can be preserved even better.

places.generalDescription: The ISKCON Radha Govind Temple, built by the International Society for Krishna Consciousness, is a serene sanctuary dedicated to the eternal couple Radha and Krishna. The temple in Indore boasts exquisite architecture with intricate carvings and beautiful sculptures that leave visitors in awe. Made of pure marble, the deities exude a calming presence, while lush green gardens add to the tranquil atmosphere. Open to all visitors, the temple offers a perfect setting for spiritual introspection and meditation.

sources.snippet: Let your healing process begin in the presence of Shri Krishna‚Äôs soothing hymns and vibrations. The beautiful deities of Radha and Krishna are made purely from marble and are beautifully crafted. Being in their midst brings out a sense of calm in you and is one of the reasons this temple is a must visit when you are in Indore.Entry Timings: 7:00 a.m.

places.name: ISKCON Radha Govind Temple

reviews.text: "Experience unparalleled spiritual rejuvenation at the ISKCON Temple Indore, a sanctuary radiating amazing vibes and profound bliss. Visitors consistently rave about the mind-blowing kirtan sessions that uplift the soul, making every visit a truly pleasurable and memorable experience. Discover why this temple is a must-visit destination for peace, devotion, and an incredible spiritual journey in Indore."
The place is in development and is a very simple and meagre temple. But the community connected is good and the aura is calm.

Yes - ISKCON Indore (Sri Sri Radha Govind Mandir, Nipania) is widely considered a peaceful and devotional haven, particularly suited for Krishna devotees seeking natural worship, calm, and spiritual immersion.

üåº Atmosphere & Devotion

Visitors frequently describe the temple as serene and spiritually uplifting.

Although relatively small and less commercial than other ISKCON temples, it's noted for its quiet surroundings and simple, sincere ambiance.

üîî Spiritual Practices & Worship

The temple offers daily arati, bhajans, kirtans, and prasadam distribution, providing an immersive devotional environment.

Instructions in Bhakti Yoga, meditation sessions, Bhagavad Gita lectures, and festival celebrations (Janmashtami, Radhashtami, Gaura Purnima, Ratha Yatra) give seekers multiple avenues for deepening their spiritual life.

places.address: Hare Krishna Vihar, Nipania, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452016, India

places.generalDescription: Meghdoot Garden, also known as Meghdoot Upavan, is a historic and well-designed park in Indore. It offers lush greenery, beautiful pathways for romantic strolls, and serene ponds for relaxation. The garden is popular for activities like running, yoga, cricket, and even camel rides. Families can enjoy the expansive green spaces and spot roaming peacocks while kids can have fun at an affordable entry fee of just 5 rupees.

sources.snippet: It is one of the oldest gardens in the city and its glory has only augmented with time. A perfect place for a stroll in the evening of a morning jog, this place is a must visit for people who like to dwell in their own thoughts and enjoy the company of nature. The park is dotted with beautiful misty fountains and also has a special children's play area.Entry Timings: 8:00 a.m.

places.generalDescription: Kanch Mandir, also known as the Temple of Glass, is a Jain temple in Indore, India. Built by Seth Hukumchand in 1903, this lavish temple is entirely covered in glass panels and mosaic artwork. The interiors are adorned with intricate glass mosaics, chandeliers, and an onyx statue of Mahavira.

sources.snippet: Built by Seth Hukam Chand in 1903 and true to its name, the interiors of the temple are completely covered by glass panels and mirrors. The intricate detailing on the glass reflects the talent and dedication of the artists and is an architectural marvel you should visit.Entry Timings: 5:00 a.m. to 8:15 p.m.Address: Kaanch Mandir, Opposite Kaanch Mandir, Itwaria Bazaar, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452002

sources.snippet: Kanch Mandir or the Temple of Glass is a famous Jain temple built by Seth Hukam Chand in 1903. True to the name, the interiors of the temple are completely covered by glass panels and mirrors. Chinese lamps add to the visual splendor of the interiors, making it one of the must-visit attractions in Indore for tourists and devotees alike.

reviews.text:
The temple is beautifully maintained and exudes a sense of peace and serenity.
An amazing glass art can be seen on the wall of the temple, it is very beautiful. The architecture is stunning, with intricate details that reflect the rich cultural heritage.The atmosphere of the temple is very peaceful.

Kanch Mandir is truly mesmerizing with its intricate mirror art, creating a stunning visual experience. It's a Jain temple, so followers come here to pray and perform pooja. Be respectful and avoid interfering with their prayers-keep your phone on DND and no photography allowed in side the temple.It's a place best experienced in person, where the beauty of the mirrors should be seen with your own eyes. Persons from all over India as well as foreign Tourist come to see this temple. Very beautiful temple and famous in Jain's Community.

Very nice place. I was truly mesmerized by seeing the mirror architecture of the temple. And on top of that they make sure nobody uses phones inside the temple, which I quite appreciate. places.generalDescription: Shree Bada Ganpati Mandir, located in Indore, is a highly revered Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha. The temple is famous for its enormous and brightly colored statue of the elephant-headed deity, which is believed to be the largest in the world. This 19th-century temple attracts devotees and tourists who come to seek blessings from Lord Ganesha.

sources.snippet: At a distance of 3 km from Indore Junction, Bada Ganpati Temple is a Hindu temple situated at the western end of the MG Road, Indore Madhya Pradesh. It is one of the many Ganesh temples in Indore, and among the most sacred Indore places to visit.
sources.shortName: 32 Best Places to Visit in Indore, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

places.name: Shree Bada Ganpati Mandir

reviews.text:
This temple was built by Pandit Narayana Dadhich in 1875. This temple earns its name due to the size of Lord Ganesha's idol - at the height of about 25 feet from crown to foot, it is said to be one of the largest idols of the God in the world. The statue is made of a peculiar mixture of limestone, jaggery, bricks and sacred soil and water from the major pilgrim places in the country. Located at the end of a quiet lane in the city of Indore, the Bada Ganpati may be a modest-looking temple, but it holds significance simply based on the enormity of the Lord's statue.

There are conflicting accounts of how the sacred abode came into existence. Established in the year 1875 by Shri Dadich, the construction of Bada Ganpati Temple was brought about by the family members Holkar Dynasty, the rulers of the region then. The Queen Ahilya Bai Holkar undertook the project under her wing more than 100 years ago. Ganpati is said to be the bringer of happiness and prosperity. The Lord is worshipped at the beginning of any new event, venture, or pooja in the entire nation. Devotees from all over the world come to Indore to visit this statue which has a high religious significance.

Devotees of Ganpati should definitely have this temple on their itinerary. It is especially ideal during the festive season when there is a constant celebration through poojas and sweet offerings to the Lord Ganesha in the hope of seeking blessings for peace, prosperity, and well-being.
The darshan timing for Bada Ganesh temple is 7:00 AM To 10:00 AM and 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM, on Tuesday from 5:00 AM to 12:00 PM and 4:00 PM to 8:30 PM.

Worth a visit if you are in Indore. It's a little offbeat though. Out of way. It's a small temple, only the idol is large.

So if time is a constraint, you may leave it.
Small temple inside Indore City. There is not much space for parking. The big Ganapati idol is beautiful and somewhat different.

places.address: PRCR+6QM, Bada Ganpati, Malharganj, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452002, India

sources.snippet: Perched atop a hill, the Devguradia Shiva Temple provides panoramic views of the city and a spiritual ambiance. This location offers couples an opportunity to incorporate a serene and devotional atmosphere into their pre-wedding photographs.
sources.shortName: Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Locations in Indore

reviews.text: Very beautiful and peaceful Shiva temple.  There are water tanks almost 12ft in depth inside the premise. A little away from the main city of Indore this was worth a visit.

This temple is dedicated to lord Shiva ji, The temple is located in Devguradia village, approximately 1-2 km from AB, bypass road Indore. One kund is available in this temple, where there are many fish and tortoise.

Devguradia Temple, near Indore, Madhya Pradesh, is dedicated to Lord Shiva.  Legend connects it to the Pandavas from the Mahabharata.  It's believed they stayed here during their exile.  The temple's architecture, though simple, holds spiritual significance.  A key feature is the natural spring within the temple complex, considered sacred.  Devguradia is a popular pilgrimage site, especially during Shivaratri.

places.generalDescription: Nestled along the serene banks of the Saraswati River, Krishna Pura Chhatri in Indore is a stunning cenotaph that pays homage to the Holkar rulers of the 19th century. This remarkable monument features intricate wall carvings and statues that reflect the grandeur of its time, making it one of Indore's most cherished landmarks. As you explore this architectural gem, you'll be captivated by its exquisite Gopuram Mandap, showcasing beautiful textures and symmetry.

sources.snippet: If you plan your pre-wedding shoot in Indore you can get ample of options like Maheshwar Fort, Krishna Pura Chhatri, Kajligarh Fort, Jahaz Mahal, Mandu, Nehru Park, Tichha Falls, Hindola Mahal, These paces with ancient architecture provide the best locations for pre-wedding shoots background. You can also go for Lalbagh Palace for royal pre-wedding shoot.

sources.snippet: If you are a couple looking for the charm of old structures and royal heritage, then Krishna Puri Chhatri is the Ideal pre-wedding shoot locations in Indore for you. Located in the city center, this place was a resting place of Holkars. Elegant Maratha-style architecture, artificial fountains, and beautiful gardens are a sight to behold.

places.name: Krishna Pura Chhatri, Indore

reviews.text: A very beautiful place which used to be a place of cremation in the period of the Holkar rulers. It is now a beautiful temple. You can visit it while you are in Indore. The best time to visit is before 12 afternoon to avoid heat or after 5 in the evening.

Krishna Pura Chhatri is a beautiful piece of Indore's heritage that offers a glimpse into the city's royal past. The intricately carved cenotaphs (chhatris) are stunning and make for a peaceful visit, especially if you enjoy history and architecture. The area is charming, especially around sunset when the lights come on and the surroundings feel even more magical.

However, the site could definitely be better maintained - some parts look neglected, and cleanliness around the area can be an issue. It's also located in a busy market zone, so reaching it might feel chaotic. Still, if you're in Indore and love exploring cultural spots, it's worth a visit for sure.

A perfect spot for photography lovers and those who appreciate the old-world charm!
The river nearby smells very bad.. The construction of Krishna Chhatri is very beautiful, it feels nice and cool inside.. The photos there also come out great.

places.generalDescription: Lal Bagh Palace, a lavish 19th-century mansion of the Holkar dynasty, showcases a blend of baroque, rococo, and neoclassical architectural styles. This three-story palace has been transformed into a grand museum featuring Italian and Indian paintings, exquisite chandeliers, and furnishings reflecting early Georgian and late Persian designs. Spanning across 28 hectares of land, it stands as a testament to the opulence and culture of the Maratha kingdom.

sources.snippet: Pre-wedding picture shoots usually occur in Indore's lavish Lal Bagh Palace, exemplifying riches and magnificence. places.name: Lal Bagh Palace

reviews.text: Lalbagh Palace is the most beautiful palace in Indore and it is also the most beautiful palace in India. Here it is shown how the kings used to live. The park here is very beautiful. It is very nice and very environment friendly, so if you want to spend some time alone, then definitely come here and gain knowledge by coming here.

Discover the Grandeur of Lal Bagh Palace, Indore
Explore the rich history of the Holkar dynasty at Lal Bagh Palace, a grand reminder of Indore's royal past. Spread over 28 acres, this beautiful palace has European-style architecture with Italian marble, big chandeliers, and decorative ceilings. The gates look like those of Buckingham Palace, and the lovely rose gardens add to its charm.

üï∞Ô∏è Visiting Hours:

Closed: Monday

Best Time to Visit: The ideal period to explore Lal Bagh Palace is from October to March, when Indore experiences pleasant weather, making sightseeing comfortable and enjoyable.

Arrive Early: To avoid crowds and enjoy a serene experience come around 10-10:30 am, as this is the opening time

Photography: Permitted with applicable charges;  Only mobile photography is allowed without any cost .

Guided Tours: Consider hiring a guide to gain deeper insights into the palace's history and architecture.

Embark on a journey through time and immerse yourself in the regal splendor of Lal Bagh Palace-a must-visit for history enthusiasts and architecture admirers alike.

Lal bagh palace is maintained historic place to visit in Indore. Time required to see full palace in 25-30 min. Since it is old palace, it gives you heritage vibe while roaming into the palace. places.generalDescription: Gandhi Hall, originally known as King Edward Hall, is a historical building in Indore, India. Constructed in 1904, it showcases impressive Indo-Gothic architecture with elaborate windows, minarets, and domes. The facade is made of white marble and red stones and features a unique clock tower on all four sides. After India gained independence in 1947, the hall was renamed Gandhi Hall in honor of Mahatma Gandhi.

sources.snippet: Gandhi Hall is the name given to the town hall of Indore, which is the main venue for art and cultural exhibitions in the city. The highlight of the hall is its grand design, which is a sight in itself. Built in the year 1904, the edifice boasts of Indo Gothic style of architecture, complete with domes, minarets, and a clock tower.
sources.shortName: Top 34 Places to Visit in Indore: Location, Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: This hall while being one of the most striking colonial structures in Indore is also the main venue for art and cultural exhibitions in the city. Its main highlight is the grand design which is a sight in itself. The edifice boasts of Indo Gothic style of architecture, complete with domes, minarets, and a clock tower.

reviews.text: We have organized an Internship Fair by IndoriX. Had a great experience with the place. It is calm, and relaxing, and you can find multiple events happening here in weekend.

Beautiful Architecture with a Historic Vibe.

Gandhi Hall in Indore is a stunning piece of architecture with its old-world charm. The place has a historic vibe, making it perfect for photography or just appreciating the design. It's well-maintained, but could use a little more care in some areas. Overall, it's a great spot to visit for anyone who loves history and architecture.

Constructed in 1904 by the acclaimed architect Charles Frederick Stevens from Mumbai, Gandhi Hall was initially named King Edward Hall. In 1905, the grand opening of the hall was officiated by George V, the Prince of Wales, with a total cost amounting to ‚Çπ2,50,000. The architectural style is Indo-Gothic, featuring white stones from Seoni and red stones from Patan, both in Madhya Pradesh.

In 1948, H. H. Yeshwant Rao Holkar II renamed the hall as Gandhi Hall in honor of Mahatma Gandhi after a gap of 50 years. The recent renovation under the ‚ÄòSmart City Indore' project in 2021 restored the hall to its original grandeur. The interiors now boast marble flooring, a wooden stage, captivating paintings on the walls, and a meticulously restored clock tower.

places.address: 51, Mahatma Gandhi Rd, Shastri Market, New Siyaganj, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452007, India

places.generalDescription: Step into the Central Museum in Indore and take a journey through time, exploring over 10,000 rare artifacts that span from prehistoric fossils to medieval sculptures. The museum showcases the rich cultural heritage of the region with diverse galleries and intriguing displays. After marveling at antique swords and stone-carved jharokhas from royal times, relax at the cafe before continuing your exploration.

sources.snippet: One of the most interesting buildings in Indore, it is a treat to the eye for people genuinely fascinated by the history of India and the rich civilization that flourished here in the pre historic age. The museum displays some of the most rare and elegant collections which is why this palace is a must visit when you are in Indore.Entry Timings: 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.Address: Near GPO Square, Residency, Navlakha, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452001
sources.shortName: 46 Best Places to Visit in Indore

places.generalDescription: The White Church in Indore is a significant landmark, dating back to 1858 and showcasing ornate split-level facades and spires topped by red-tiled roofs. Constructed with the support of Sir Robert North Hamilton, the then Governor General of India, this colonial structure near the Maharajah's palace Rajwada reflects British influence prior to independence. Designed by British engineer Ross McMahon, it features a simple European style with turrets and large windows.

sources.snippet: One of the oldest churches in Central India, it was built by the Governor general, Sir Robert M C Hamilton in the year 1858. The church was mainly built for the British army personnel who came to the city often during the pre-independence era but is visited by locals as well as tourists from all over the world. The architecture is inspired by the protestant churches in Britain and is a sight to behold.Entry Timings: 7:00 a.m.
sources.shortName: 46 Best Places to Visit in Indore

sources.snippet: A peek into the impact of British autonomy on Indore pre-independence, the Indore White Church is one of the most significant points of interest of the city. A testimony to awe-striking European architecture, the entire structure is made of milk white stone and marble. To witness the church in all its glory during Christmas, decorated from head to toe, is a sight for sore eyes.

places.generalDescription: Regional Park Indore, also known as Pipliyapala Regional Park or Atal Bihari Vajpayee Regional Park, is a sprawling 122-acre recreational destination in Indore. The park features an impressive 80-acre lake and offers a variety of attractions and activities for both adults and children. Visitors can enjoy pedal-boating and motor-boating on the lake, explore the Mist and Musical Fountain, French Gardens, Labyrinths, Artist Village, and more.

sources.snippet: If you want to engage in some in some fun-filled activities like pedal-boating and motor-boating and witness the magical allure of the Mist and Musical Fountain, French Gardens, Labyrinths and the Artist Village, Pipliyapala Park is a must visit. The park has been developed by the Indore Development Authority and draws visitors for its beautiful musical fountains and lush gardens.Entry Timings: 11:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.Address: Regional Park Rd, Pipliya Pala, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452020
sources.shortName: 46 Best Places to Visit in Indore

sources.snippet: Pipliyapala Regional Park | #14 of 34 Places to Visit in Indore. Spread over a sprawling area of 80 acres, the Pipliyapala Regional Park aka Atal Bihari Vajpayee Regional Park comprises of a huge lake and a number of attractions to delight adults and kids alike. Musical fountains, boating, lush gardens, jumping jet fountains,  lake viewpoints, food zones, and an amphitheater are some of the main highlights of the park.

places.generalDescription: Lotus Lake, also known as Lotus Valley, is a captivating water body located on the outskirts of the city in Gulawat village. A popular spot for picnics and nature enthusiasts, it offers a serene getaway from the hustle and bustle of Indore. The lake provides breathtaking views and is adorned with blooming lotus flowers. It's an ideal place to relax with friends or family away from the chaos of city life.

sources.snippet: The Lotus Lake, otherwise called the Yashwant Lake, situated in the Gulawat Lotus Valley is a shockingly captivating spot on the edges of Indore. reviews.text: Place is good, This place is a paradise for nature lovers, offering stunning natural beauty and a peaceful environment. However, it has become more crowded with tourists in recent times, especially during peak seasons. To help preserve its charm, carry your own reusable waste bag, as local vendors, often lacking proper awareness about waste disposal, tend to burn plastic waste like disposable plates in the evening, which harms the environment. Although parking is free but finding parking spot can be bit challenging in weekends.

places.generalDescription: Nehru Park, formerly known as Biscoe Park, is a popular attraction in Indore. It's not only a beautiful green space but also a haven for birdwatchers due to its fully-grown fig trees that attract various bird species. The park is also home to the Chidiya Ghar zoological park, where visitors can see exotic flora and fauna and even rare animals like the White Tigress with her cubs.

sources.snippet: Famously known as Chidiya ghar, Nehru Park is a zoological park in the city and houses exotic flora and fauna. The zoo is dedicated to taking care of animals and plants, while making an effort of providing them with their natural habitat at the most. There is also a children's playing area, which includes an open garden along with some fun rides.Entry Timings: 9:00 a.m.

places.generalDescription: Sirpur Lake is a huge man-made lake in Indore which is home to more than 130 species of birds. The rich biodiversity of Sirpur Lake makes it one of the most popular tourist attractions in Indore, and birdwatchers from all over India visit here every winter to marvel at the variety of migratory birds.

sources.snippet: One of the biggest lakes in Indore, Sirpur Lake is a pronounced Bird and Biodiversity Region spread over a picture location Indoreenormous area of very nearly 800 sections of land, which incorporates the encompassing wetlands too. The lake is a popular tourist destination in Indore for wildlife picture location Indore and nature lovers. Visit Sirpur Lake to immerse yourself in nature's magic as the picture location Indore endless lake hypnotizes you and the cool breeze gently kisses you.

The lake is a popular tourist spot in Indore amongst nature lovers and wildlife enthusiasts. Visit the Sirpur Lake to drench yourself in the magic of nature as the endless lake mesmerizes you while the cool breeze kisses you gently.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Instagrammable Places in Indore

places.name: Sirpur lake

reviews.text: Excellent spot for morning and evening walk. Went in the morning, lot of peacocks and squirrels. The greenery and sunrise vibe is worth the visit. Walkway surrounding the lake is clean and maintained.

Very beautiful place. The pathway alongside lake is very beautiful canvas of clay and trees on the both side. Since the place is home to many birds, it's good to visit during daytime specially in winters so that there's is less noise and hence a better experience. The symphony of sounds of water, birds and rustling sound of wind is amazing. This part of the lake is ecological sensitive zone hence it's important to avoid unnecessary loud sound

Is a great place to visit especially during the sunrise to watch the numerous migratory birds chirping and singing to their own tunes. The maintenance is indeed very clean and good and is a great place to hangout for people of all ages
Sirpur Lake was created by the Holkars of Indore State in the early 20th century. The lake was recognized by BirdLife International as one of the 19 important bird areas (IBAs) of Madhya Pradesh in 2015. In July, 2022, the Sirpur wetland was declared a Ramsar site.
If you are in Indore than you have to visit tis place

places.address: PR36+3RX, Sirpur, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452013, India

places.generalDescription: Annapurna Temple, located in Indore, is a renowned pilgrimage center dedicated to Goddess Annapurna, the deity of food. This sacred site also houses shrines for Sivan, Hanuman, and Kalabhairava. The temple's serene environment makes it an ideal place for spiritual reflection and peace. Constructed with beautiful marble stones, it offers a tranquil and pleasant atmosphere for visitors seeking solace. Additionally, the premises include other temples worth exploring during your visit.

sources.snippet: The temple is dedicated to Goddess Annapurna, the deity of food and an incarnation of Goddess Parvati. The temple is even more special because it houses the shrines of Sivan, Hanuman and Kalabhairava. this temple is one among the famous pilgrimage centres in Indore.

sources.snippet: The intricate architecture and serene surroundings of the Annapurna Temple offer a spiritual and traditional backdrop for pre-wedding photoshoots. Couples can capture the essence of divine blessings as they embark on their new journey together.
